author: @infobae
title: Qu√© es y c√≥mo tomar ashwagandha, el popular suplemento que sirve para bajar el cortisol - Infobae
text:
La ashwagandha ha ganado popularidad debido a sus beneficios relacionados con el combate del estr√©s - (Imagen Ilustrativa Infobae) Recientemente se ha comenzado a hablar sobre el impacto negativo que tiene en la salud la producci√≥n excesiva del cortisol, la cual es conocida como la hormona del estr√©s debido a que suele generarse como respuesta a este estado.
Es por ello que tambi√©n ha ganado popularidad un suplemento elaborado con una ra√≠z a la que se le atribuyen beneficios particularmente ben√©ficos para ayudar al cuerpo a controlar y disminuir su producci√≥n.
Nos referimos a la ashwagandha, conocida cient√≠ficamente como Withania somnifera , la cual es una planta medicinal originaria de la India que ha sido utilizada en la medicina tradicional ayurv√©dica durante siglos y sobre la cu√°l te contamos por qu√© es reconocida como el suplemento ideal para ayudar a mantener a raya al cortisol y sus terribles efectos negativos para la salud.
La ashwagandha se utiliza principalmente en suplementos y extractos, y se le atribuyen posibles beneficios como la reducci√≥n del estr√©s y la ansiedad - (Imagen Ilustrativa Infobae) Por qu√© los suplementos de la ashwagandha ayudan a bajar el cortisol Los suplementos de ashwagandha se asocian con la reducci√≥n de los niveles de cortisol debido a que a la planta con la que se elaboran se le atribuyen propiedades adapt√≥genas, es decir que ayuda al cuerpo a enfrentar el estr√©s f√≠sico, mental y emocional.
El cortisol es una hormona liberada por el cuerpo en respuesta al estr√©s, y niveles elevados durante per√≠odos prolongados pueden provocar efectos negativos en la salud, como fatiga, aumento de peso y debilidad del sistema inmunol√≥gico.
Estudios cient√≠ficos sugieren que los compuestos bioactivos de la ashwagandha, como los withan√≥lidos , influyen en la regulaci√≥n del eje hipot√°lamo-hip√≥fisis-suprarrenal (HHS), el sistema responsable de la respuesta al estr√©s.
Esto podr√≠a ayudar a reducir el exceso de producci√≥n de cortisol y mejorar la tolerancia del cuerpo al estr√©s por lo que su consumo
Este suplemento puede ayudar a combatir los efectos negativos causados por el estr√©s (Imagen Ilustrativa Infobae) Cu√°les son los beneficios de la ashwagandha para la salud Adem√°s de sus beneficios para ayudar a reducir los niveles de cortisol, la ashwagandha, utilizada tradicionalmente en la medicina ayurv√©dica, se asocia con muchos otros beneficios para la salud, entre los cuales destacan los siguientes:
Reducci√≥n del estr√©s y la ansiedad : Como mencionamos, gracias a sus propiedades adapt√≥genas, puede ayudar a disminuir los niveles de cortisol, mejorando la capacidad del cuerpo para manejar el estr√©s. Mejora de la calidad del sue√±o : Se le atribuye un efecto relajante que promueve un sue√±o m√°s reparador. Aumento de energ√≠a y vitalidad : Puede apoyar los niveles de energ√≠a al reducir el cansancio relacionado con el estr√©s. Fortalecimiento del sistema inmunol√≥gico : Se cree que ayuda a regular la respuesta inmune y a combatir la inflamaci√≥n. Mejora de la salud cognitiva : Algunos estudios sugieren que podr√≠a favorecer la memoria, concentraci√≥n y claridad mental. Apoyo a la salud hormonal : En algunos casos, se ha asociado con una mejora en los niveles de testosterona y un apoyo general al equilibrio hormonal. Salud cardiovascular : Puede ayudar a reducir algunos factores de riesgo, como los niveles de colesterol y triglic√©ridos. Como siempre mencionamos, se recomienda consultar a un profesional de la salud antes de su consumo, ya que podr√≠a tener contraindicaciones o interacciones con algunos medicamentos.

author: VNExplorer
title: Christmas Eve weather: Severe thunderstorms forecast for parts of Australia - what the conditions look like in Sydney, Brisbane, Melbourne
text:
Severe thunderstorms forecast for Christmas EveNSW, Queensland and Victoria in firing line
NSW, Queensland and Victoria could face severe thunderstorms on Christmas Eve with residents told to prepare for the potential for hail, flash flooding and heavy rains.
Major storm concerns are held for ‚Äòthe vast majority of NSW‚Äô and Queensland, stretching all the way from Mackay to the state‚Äôs south east.
The Bureau of Meteorology‚Äôs senior meteorologist Angus Hines said the activity was forecast to peak on Sunday afternoon.
‚ÄòThe particular area where we‚Äôre likely to see severe thunderstorms is around Southeast Queensland including the Brisbane region and northeast NSW,‚Äô he said.
‚ÄòWe could see some of those thunderstorms get really big, really intense and they could potentially cause damaging to destructive wind gusts heavy to locally intense rainfall and large or even the giant sized hail as we saw yesterday.‚Äô
An outbreak of thunderstorms will affect many areas around NSW & Qld today -some of these thunderstorms may be severe. A low pressure system developing Christmas Eve near the Vic/NSW border will drag the storm risk sth across much of #Vic Xmas Day. Latest: https://t.co/4W35o8i7wJ pic.twitter.com/q9UioJ4xYh
‚Äî Bureau of Meteorology, Australia (@BOM_au) December 23, 2023
NSW, Queensland and Victoria could face severe thunderstorms on Christmas Eve with residents told to prepare for the potential for hail, flash flooding and heavy rains
On Sunday morning, BOM issued a severe thunderstorm warning for parts of central Queensland, with the potential for damaging wind, heavy rainfall and large hail.
This follows a spate of severe storms on Saturday, with high temperatures fuelling the weather activity.
The current warning is for areas across the southern Darling Downs, and Granite Belt district, however the weather authority said the activity will likely move eastwards in over the next few hours.
In NSW, showers and severe thunderstorms will mainly occur in the central and eastern inland areas, with lighter storms forecast near the coast and far west.
Up to 30mm of rain is forecast for Sydney on Sunday, with the chance for showers easing into the night.
üå©Ô∏è#SevereThunderstorms have developed over the southern #DarlingDowns & Granite Belt district. Large hail, damaging winds & heavy rainfall are possible. Activity is likely move east over the next few hours. Updates: https://t.co/G5LAzkEaQ1 pic.twitter.com/9V8di5ic3D
‚Äî Bureau of Meteorology, Queensland (@BOM_Qld) December 23, 2023
Massive storms are forecast for Christmas Eve with the grim weather a departure from the characteristic, end-of-year heatwave
The Bureau warned a low pressure system developing on the NSW/ Victoria border will drag the storm risk ‚Äòacross much of Victoria‚Äô on Christmas Eve, bringing wet weather as the day progresses
Melbourne‚Äôs Carols by Candlelight also faces a potential washout, with a high chance of showers, and a possible thunderstorm forecast for the late afternoon and evening. The outdoors event will begin at the Sidney Myer Music Bowl from 8pm, with organisers adamant the show will go on rain, hail or shine.
The Bureau warned a low pressure system developing on the NSW/ Victoria border will drag the storm risk ‚Äòacross much of Victoria‚Äô on Christmas Eve, bringing wet weather as the day progresses.
‚ÄòShowers of course, by their nature, tend to be a little spotty a little hit and miss ‚Äì so there‚Äôs still a chance we‚Äôll get the carols in the dry but there‚Äôs a risk of showers across Melbourne City at that time of day,‚Äô said Mr Hines.While the eastern states could face a wet Christmas, multiple severe heatwave warnings remain in place for Western Australia.
The Bureau have issued a warning for the Pilbara, Gascoyne, North Interior and South Interior Districts, where temperatures could reach up to 45C.
The alert is currently in place until Boxing Day.

author: @AsianetNewsEN
title: Want to pursue a career in pharmacy? Explore the best colleges across India
text:
Looking for a career in the medical field without becoming a doctor? Pharmacy is an excellent option. This article lists the top 10 pharmacy colleges in India based on the NIRF 2024 rankings, with Jamia Hamdard taking the top spot.
Top 10 Pharmacy Colleges in India: If you aspire to a medical career but don't want to be a doctor, pharmacy offers a great alternative, especially for students who have completed or will complete their 12th grade with a biology background. This article highlights the top 10 pharmacy colleges in India, providing a pathway to a rewarding career.
Why Choose a Career in Pharmacy?
The role of a pharmacist extends beyond dispensing medications. Pharmacy offers diverse career paths, including research, medical writing, healthcare management, and drug development. This explains why thousands of students enroll in pharmacy courses like B Pharm, M Pharm, and Pharm D every year.
Which is India's No. 1 Pharmacy College?
Jamia Hamdard, New Delhi, holds the top rank as India's No. 1 pharmacy college according to the NIRF Ranking 2024, solidifying its position as the premier institution for pharmacy education in the country.
List of Top 10 Pharmacy Colleges (NIRF Ranking 2024)
Rank | College Name |
1 | Jamia Hamdard, New Delhi |
2 | National Institute of Pharmaceutical Education & Research, Hyderabad |
3 | Birla Institute of Technology and Science (BITS), Pilani |
4 | JSS College of Pharmacy, Ooty |
5 | Institute of Chemical Technology, Mumbai |
6 | JSS College of Pharmacy, Mysuru |
7 | Panjab University, Chandigarh |
8 | Manipal College of Pharmaceutical Sciences, Manipal |
9 | National Institute of Pharmaceutical Education & Research, Mohali |
10 | SVKM‚Äôs Narsee Monjee Institute of Management Studies (NMIMS), Mumbai |
What's Special About the Top 10 Pharmacy Colleges?
Two colleges from Karnataka (JSS Mysuru and Manipal College) feature in the top 10. Graduates from these institutions have excellent job prospects in research, the pharmaceutical industry, government jobs, and health technology sectors. Some colleges offer direct admission, while others require entrance exams.
Want to Enroll in B Pharm or M Pharm?
If you're interested in B Pharm or M Pharm programs, visit the college websites for admission guidelines, fee structures, and entrance exam dates. Admission can be secured through prominent exams like NEET, MHT-CET, or GPAT. If you seek a rewarding and responsible career in the medical field without pursuing MBBS, pharmacy is a smart choice. The list of top colleges provided above can guide your career path.

author: PTI
title: As society, we are collectively indebted to our soldiers: Rajnath | Politics
text: As society, we are collectively indebted to our soldiers: Rajnath [PTI](/pti-stories)| Surat | Updated: 30-12-2023 22:19 IST | Created: 30-12-2023 22:19 IST - Country: - India The people of the country are collectively indebted to the soldiers who protect India's borders, Defence Minister Rajnath Singh said here on Saturday. The principle of ''security first'' flows from ''India first'', he said at a programme organised by the Maruti Veer Jawan Trust here to honour and offer monetary support to the families of 131 martyred soldiers. ''All those working within the borders of this nation, whether they are scientists, businessmen, persons engaged in any profession or those running the government, are able to do so because our brave soldiers are protecting our borders with a strong sense of national pride,'' Singh said in his speech. ''You and I are someone who follow the path of `India first'. If `India first' is the path to be followed, then security also comes first. Therefore, the concept of `security first' comes with the concept of `India first','' the Union minister said. A soldier's duty and responsibility are unique because he faces death every day and knows that an enemy bullet can come from anywhere, any time, he said. ''Despite knowing this, they protect the borders with all their heart and soul. This happens because our soldiers have a feeling of love for the security of this nation and the people of this nation. There is a strong sense of national self-respect within them too. As society, we are collectively indebted to our soldiers,'' Singh said. Many of India's soldiers come from very ordinary, poor families, and they join the Army because they have the passion to do something for the country, he said, adding, ''these diamonds, with their shine, have never allowed darkness to come into the country, and will never allow darkness to come.'' ''Some diamonds come out of the ground in the form of (precious) stones, while some diamonds are in the form of humans, who are created by their behavior and their values. There is also a diamond which protects the borders of the country,'' he said. The Maruti Veer Jawan Trust provided financial assistance of Rs 2.5 lakh each to the families of 131 martyred soldiers by way of tribute, a release said. (This story has not been edited by Devdiscourse staff and is auto-generated from a syndicated feed.) - READ MORE ON: - [Rajnath Singh](/news?tag=Rajnath+Singh) - [India](/news?tag=India) - [Singh](/news?tag=Singh) - [The Maruti Veer Jawan Trust](/news?tag=The+Maruti+Veer+Jawan+Trust) - [Rs 2.5](/news?tag=Rs+2.5) - [Army](/news?tag=Army) ALSO READ ["Felt we could have chased it down": SA skipper Markram after loss to India](/article/sports-games/2746710-felt-we-could-have-chased-it-down-sa-skipper-markram-after-loss-to-india) [Kuldeep's five-wicket haul, Suryakumar's ton help India beat SA by 106 runs](/article/sports-games/2746702-kuldeeps-five-wicket-haul-suryakumars-ton-help-india-beat-sa-by-106-runs) [Oman Sultan to arrive in India today for three-day state visit](/article/international/2746700-oman-sultan-to-arrive-in-india-today-for-three-day-state-visit) [India, US co-chair AML/CFT Dialogue, agree to improve cooperation against money laundering, terror financing](/article/international/2746741-india-us-co-chair-amlcft-dialogue-agree-to-improve-cooperation-against-money-laundering-terror-financing) [UK: Indian consulate organises event to celebrate 554th birth anniversary of Guru Nanak Dev in Cardiff](/article/international/2746720-uk-indian-consulate-organises-event-to-celebrate-554th-birth-anniversary-of-guru-nanak-dev-in-cardiff)

author: Redaktion
title: Klage gegen vegetarisches Schulessen scheitert vor Gericht
text:
Verwaltungsgerichtshof Baden-W√ºrttemberg
Klage gegen vegetarisches Schulessen scheitert vor Gericht
Eine Sch√ºlerin und ihre Eltern forderten mehr Fleisch im Schulessen ‚Äì das Gericht wies die Klage ab.
Eine Sch√ºlerin in Baden-W√ºrttemberg hat laut Gerichtsentscheid keinen Anspruch auf ein t√§gliches Fleisch- oder Fischangebot beim Schulessen. Die Eltern und ihre Tochter aus dem Raum Konstanz scheiterten mit Beschwerden gegen ein √ºberwiegend vegetarisches Schulessen vor dem Verwaltungsgerichtshof (VGH) Baden-W√ºrttemberg, wie der VGH am Donnerstag in Mannheim mitteilte. (9 S 1044/25)
Eltern kritisieren: Zu wenig Fleisch im Schulessen
Die betroffene Ganztagsschule im Raum Konstanz bietet an vier Wochentagen Essen an, an dreien davon vegetarische oder vegane Gerichte. Nur an einem Tag gibt es Fleisch oder Fisch. Dagegen gingen die Eltern gerichtlich vor. Sie begr√ºndeten dies mit einer drohenden Mangelern√§hrung und einer Nahrungsmittelunvertr√§glichkeit.
Ein Eilantrag am Verwaltungsgericht Freiburg, mit dem die Eltern erreichen wollten, dass ihrer Tochter an s√§mtlichen Tagen Fleisch oder Fisch zur Verf√ºgung gestellt wird, scheiterte jedoch. Gegen die Entscheidung legten die Eltern und ihre Tochter Beschwerde ein.
Der VGH wies die Beschwerden als unzul√§ssig zur√ºck. Er begr√ºndete dies im Fall der Eltern damit, dass diese ihre Beschwerde entgegen der gesetzlichen Vorgaben ohne Rechtsanwalt erhoben hatten. Am VGH besteht sogenannter Anwaltszwang.
Die Beschwerde der Tochter war nach der Begr√ºndung des Senats ebenfalls unzul√§ssig, weil sie im erstinstanzlichen Verfahren nicht beteiligt war und daher gar nicht befugt war f√ºr eine Beschwerde. Der Beschluss ist unanfechtbar. (afp/red)

Noch keine Kommentare ‚Äì schreiben Sie den ersten Kommentar zu diesem Artikel.

author: newsdirectory3
title: Sugary Drinks Linked to Millions of New Diabetes and Heart Disease Cases
text:
Sugary Drinks Fuel Millions of New Diabetes and Heart Disease Cases Worldwide A groundbreaking new study reveals the alarming link between sugary drinks and a surge in chronic diseases, highlighting the urgent need for global action.
Millions of new cases of type 2 diabetes and cardiovascular disease (CVD) each year can be directly attributed to the consumption of sugar-sweetened beverages, according to a study published in Nature Medicine . Conducted by researchers at Tufts University‚Äôs Friedman School of Nutrition Science and Policy, the research underscores the critical need for targeted interventions to curb sugary drink intake, notably in developing countries.
<div class="blockText blockContent TbCXh‚Äù> Sugar-Sweetened Beverages Lead to Millions of New Diabetes, CVD Cases Yearly / elenvd ‚Äì stock.adobe.com
The study, which analyzed data from the Global Dietary Database, found that in 2020, adults consumed an average of 2.6 eight-ounce servings of sugar-sweetened beverages per week.This intake varied considerably across regions, ranging from 0.7 servings in South Asia to 7.3 servings in latin America and the Caribbean.
alarmingly, the researchers estimated that these sugary drinks were responsible for 2.2 million new type 2 diabetes cases and 1.2 million new cardiovascular disease cases globally in 2020 alone.
‚ÄúSugar-sweetened beverages are heavily marketed and sold in low- and middle-income nations,‚Äù said Dariush Mozaffarian, director of the Food is Medicine institute and senior author of the study. ‚ÄúNot only are these communities consuming harmful products, but thay are also often less well equipped to deal with the long-term health consequences.‚Äù
The countries bearing the heaviest burden of new diabetes cases linked to sugary drinks were Mexico, Colombia , and South Africa. These same countries also topped the list for new cardiovascular disease cases attributed to these beverages.
‚ÄúWe need urgent, evidence-based interventions to curb consumption of sugar-sweetened beverages globally, before even more lives are shortened by their effects on diabetes and heart disease,‚Äù said Laura Lara-Castor, the study‚Äôs first author.
The study‚Äôs findings underscore the critical need for public health policies aimed at reducing sugary drink consumption. These coudl include taxation, restrictions on marketing, and promoting access to healthier beverage options.
Sugary Drinks: A Sweet Threat too Global Health Maria: Did you read that shocking article about sugary drinks causing millions of new diabetes and heart disease cases worldwide?
Alex: No, I missed it. What‚Äôs going on?
Maria: Basically, this study published in Nature Medicine found a direct link between sugary drinks and a surge in these chronic diseases. It‚Äôs incredibly alarming!
alex: Wow, that‚Äôs scary. How many cases are we talking about?
Maria: The researchers estimated that in 2020 alone, sugary drinks were responsible for 2.2 million new cases of type 2 diabetes and 1.2 million new cases of cardiovascular disease globally. That‚Äôs a huge number!
Alex: I knew sugary drinks weren‚Äôt good for you, but I had no idea it was this bad. Which countries are most affected?
Maria: According to the study, Mexico, Colombia, and South Africa are hit the hardest. These countries are also the ones where people consume the most sugary drinks, sadly.
Alex: Is ther anything being done to address this issue?
Maria: The study authors are calling for urgent action. They believe governments need to implement policies like taxation,restrictions on marketing these drinks,especially to children,and promoting healthier alternatives.
Alex: That makes sense. It seems like a combination of individual choices and public health interventions is needed to tackle this problem.
Maria: Exactly. We need to be aware of the dangers of sugary drinks and make conscious choices about what we consume. And we need governments to step up and create an surroundings that supports healthy choices.

author: Haley Van Horn
title: Meet the Pack: Catie Cryer | PETA Prime
text: When it comes to raising money for animals, PETA loves to be creative. And that‚Äôs when our [PETA Pack](https://petapack.peta.org/) program often comes into play. The PETA Pack is a group of runners who participate in various races‚Äîfrom full marathons to 5Ks‚Äîin the name of animal liberation. This year, six of our runners will take on the United Airlines NYC Half marathon on March 17. This 13.1-mile race will begin in Brooklyn, make its way over the historic Manhattan Bridge and up the FDR Drive, wind through Times Square (one of only two times it‚Äôs closed each year), and finish in Central Park. Each of our vegan runners will raise funds for PETA causes close to their hearts. We‚Äôll introduce you to one of our runners each week during the lead-up to the big race. [Meet Catie Cryar!](https://petapack.peta.org/283/peta-pack/144879/houston-to-nyc-to-end-rodeo-cruelty) A native Texan, she took on an inspiring PETA Pack challenge in 2019 when she ran four grueling half-marathons in just five weeks! Now she‚Äôs preparing for a new challenge‚Äîone that will call further attention to ending the abuse of animals in [rodeos](https://www.peta.org/issues/animals-in-entertainment/cruel-sports/rodeos/), where they suffer and die so that humans can play cowboy in cruel events like calf roping, bull riding, steer wrestling, and bronco riding. Rodeos are inherently cruel events that should be relegated to the history books alongside railroad barons and saloon brawls. Cows and horses may be zapped with electric ‚Äúhot shots‚Äù so that they‚Äôll charge out of a chute, calves‚Äô necks are twisted as they‚Äôre violently slammed to the ground, and horses are viciously spurred into bucking. [Support Catie‚Äôs Run!](https://petapack.peta.org/283/peta-pack/144879/houston-to-nyc-to-end-rodeo-cruelty) Want to help even more? [Create your own PETA Pack fundraiser today!](https://petapack.peta.org/)
